Goblin008.synopsis: Goblin who is building a shrine to the Absolute in your camp.

TieflingBackup003.synopsis: Generic tiefling hanging around camp after the party. Only shows up when a named tiefling is missing from the scene.

ProdigySister.synopsis: Lia's dialog after the three-way dialog with his brother and sister during the camp celebration. Lia is seated and happily reflecting on the good they have done.

OwlbearCub.synopsis: Owlbear cub's dialog after the goblin hunt celebration party. Occurs whether tieflings or raiders win, with a variation. He does not like the goblins - they captured him and made him play the chicken chase game.In SwA, he speaks like 'little bites'. Short and staccato.

Prodigy.synopsis: Rolan's dialog after the three-way dialog with his brother and sister during the camp celebration.

FlirtyTiefling.synopsis: Lakrissa is enjoying the festivities and being a bit flirty.

CourierDog.synopsis: Courier dog's dialog during the goblin hunt celebration party. The camp will be full of either tieflings or goblins. If the tieflings are present, Scratch is excited and playful; if the goblins are present, he's scared and anxious.

ProdigyBrother.synopsis: Cal's dialog after the three-way dialog with his brother and sister during the camp celebration. Cal is usually the peacekeeper of the group and is enjoying this rare moment of peace and quiet in his family. He is sitting down.

BackupLeader.synopsis: Cerys is next to the campfire, enjoying the festivities. She's not drinking, instead watching on with affection as the tieflings in her charge get blazing drunk while she plans to forage for some hangover cures. She's happy to see them this way, but also mindful she might need to be the bad guy and get them moving in the morning.

TieflingBackup001.synopsis: Chell is very tipsy and cheerfully boasting about fighting whatever they meet on the road.

Goblin001.synopsis: Goblin having a party after attack on den at player camp. This goblin looks up to the players, and offers them a lute he found on one of the tieflings.
Goblin001.how_to_trigger: 1. loadlevel WLD_Main_A2. oe readyattackonden3. oe attackondentieflingvictory4. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_TieflingPartyInvitation5. Go to camp6. Talk to Goblin Brawler sitting down at X: -636 Y: -182

UnfortunateGnome.synopsis: Unfortunate gnome's dialog after the goblin hunt celebration party. There are actually two different dialoues: one for when the player sided with the goblins, in which he is pissed off at the player and ready to leave, and one where the player sided with the tieflings, in which he is happy for them, but doesn't want to partake in the celebrations himself, since it has nothing to do with him, and he wants to go save his friend as soon as possible. In this case, he's standing next to a workbench, working on making explosive arrows (ARR_Arrow_Of_Fire).
UnfortunateGnome.how_to_trigger: oe readyattackondenoe attackondentieflingvictoryoe fullcampSetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_TieflingPartyInvitationoe qnight NIGHT_GoblinHunt_TieflingCelebration_1ad8c357-2695-4d5c-b5f9-8b8c07803121Go to camp and skip triggered dialogues.goto -625; -182Talk to Barcus.

Goblin002.synopsis: Drunk goblin who is building a shrine for the Absolute in your camp.

Drow.synopsis: The Drow attempts to seduce the player after attack on den. She's dominating and arrogant.
Drow.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- oe readyattackonden- oe attackondenraidervictory- SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_GoblinPartyInvitation - Go to camp.- Talk to Minthara

Volo.synopsis: Volo's dialog after the goblin hunt celebration party. Occurs whether tieflings or raiders win, with a variation for whether we've met Volo or not. This is his fallback in being added to our camp.In the tiefling victory variation, Volo is sitting at his desk and thinking/writing an account of our victory that day. As we approach he should set down his pen and turn to speak with us, only returning to work again once he's dismissed us.In the goblin victory celebration, Volo is standing in a cage much like the one in which he is placed in the goblin camp. In this case, he does not wish to be freed. He isn't writing anything or holding anything, but hands off his notes off-screen if intimidated into doing so.

Trainer.synopsis: Asharak is next to the campfire, enjoying the festivities.

ParentB.synopsis: Parents are on the beach after the scene with the Druid Leader OR if the scene never happened for whatever reason. Marrick has either murdered Kagha, let her live or is sitting in the dark as others celebrate - mourning her daughter.

Lover2.synopsis: Bex is standing not far away from the campfire, enjoying the festivities.

SonOfChef.synopsis: Ikaron is in a sour mood, judging his fellow tieflings for getting drunk when he thinks they should be mourning their dead, though he loosens up if the player convinces him to have a drink.He stands in the midst of a camp celebration following the successful defeat of the goblins. He's conversing with another tiefling, begrudgingly, when the player speaks to him. If the player convinces him to have a drink, he'll be a bit more conversational afterward.

TieflingBackup006.synopsis: Kivak is excited to meet the player, in a dorky kind of way. This dialogue is available during a celebration back at camp once the goblins are defeated.

ParentA.synopsis: Parents are on the beach after the scene with the Druid Leader OR if the scene never happened for whatever reason. Locke's wife Marrick has either murdered Kagha, let her live or is sitting in the dark as others celebrate. Locke is  mainly concerned for his wife at this stage and the effects the events of the night have had on her.

TieflingBackup002.synopsis: Zae is VERY drunk, excited, and planning to dance the night away. She is enthusiastic and friendly.

TieflingBackup004.synopsis: Generic tiefling hanging around camp after the party. Only shows up when a named tiefling is missing from the scene.
TieflingBackup004.how_to_trigger: - goto 163.75, 23.23, 551.75- Kill Bex and Danis (Ctrl+Shift+K).- oe readyattackonden- oe attackondentieflingvictory- SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_TieflingPartyInvitation- Go to camp. Skip through the dialogues.- In camp find Vatas. Talk to him.

Goblin003.synopsis: Goblin having a party after attack on den at player camp.

ParentsAndDruidLeader.synopsis: At camp, while everyone is celebrating, the parents of the dead kid and Sagha have a tense confrontation about the death of the child. Parents can either kill Sagha or forgive her.
ParentsAndDruidLeader.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Aoe readyattackonden (allow for flag to set)oe attackondenvictory (allow for flag to set)SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_TieflingPartyInvitationlong restgo to beach to trigger or teleport to kagha

Goblin004.synopsis: Goblin guarding your camp for you.

Lover1.synopsis: Danis is standing not far away from the campfire, enjoying the festivities.
Lover1.how_to_trigger: in recon: oe qnight NIGHT_GoblinHunt_TieflingCelebration_1ad8c357-2695-4d5c-b5f9-8b8c07803121Go to camp and skip triggered dialogues.goto -635; -181Talk to Danis.

IrritatedTiefling.synopsis: In this short dialogue, Guex is in good spirits, excited to journey to Baldur's Gate. He has an ale in-hand, enjoying a celebration in the player's camp. The player has just defeated the goblins that threatened the tiefling's refugee camp.

Goblin007.synopsis: Goblin having a party after attack on den at player camp.

TieflingBackup005.synopsis: Rhy is in good spirits, excited for the road ahead. Ale in-hand, he's enjoying the celebration at the player's camp after the goblin's defeat.

Goblin005.synopsis: Goblin keeping watch at the player's camp..

Prodigies.synopsis: Rolan is doing magic tricks with prestidigitation. He's casting a shower of silver sparks into the air, while lia and cal watch. Lia and cal are seated. Rolan is standing up. Their positions do not change.This is a sweet scene in which they're on the surface making fun of each other, but are actually really enjoying each other's company,

Bard.synopsis: Alfira the tiefling bard is standing not far away from the campfire, enjoying the festivities.

TieflingLeader.synopsis: Zevlor is next to the campfire, enjoying the festivities.

Goblin006.synopsis: Goblin having a party after attack on den at player camp.

KidLeader.synopsis: Mol the kid leader is standing on the beach far enough from the bulk of the festivities.

Goblin009.synopsis: Fanatic goblin who is building a shrine to the Absolute in your camp.

Halsin.synopsis: Speaking to Halsin during the celebrations after victory over the goblins. He encourages the player to enjoy themselves - the business they have with him can wait until morning.

Goblin008_0.speaker: Goblin Warlock
Goblin008_0.text: Our gift to the Absolute. May the whole world see His strength!

Goblin008_1.speaker: Goblin Warlock
Goblin008_1.text: Beautiful, ain't it? A tribute to our strength!

TieflingBackup003_0.speaker: Kavil
TieflingBackup003_0.text: Gods - this place is nice, but I can't wait to sleep under an actual roof again.

TieflingBackup003_1.speaker: Kavil
TieflingBackup003_1.text: Grab a drink! I'm fairly certain it's all yours anyway.
TieflingBackup003_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly tipsy, enjoying selves at a party and happy to see you

ProdigySister_2.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_2.text: Look at them. How happy they are. We did that.
ProdigySister_2.context: NodeContext: Looking around at the tieflings at the party, happy. Heartfelt.

ProdigySister_6.speaker: Player
ProdigySister_6.text: How about the three of you? Having fun?

ProdigySister_12.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_12.text: Yeah. Don't tell Rolan, but his magic show might be the highlight. He's been doing them since we were little.

ProdigySister_5.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_5.text: He'll make it big in Baldur's Gate. I know it.

ProdigySister_9.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_9.text: Me too. You're one of the good ones, you know that?

ProdigySister_7.speaker: Player
ProdigySister_7.text: I think the booze is doing more than we did.

ProdigySister_0.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_0.text: Heh. Then I'd best track down a bottle - before the rest polish it off.

ProdigySister_4.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_4.text: Look us up when you hit Baldur's Gate. Be nice to see a friendly face.

ProdigySister_10.speaker: Player
ProdigySister_10.text: We? I did all the work.

ProdigySister_1.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_1.text: Heh. You sound like Rolan. But all right. Thanks for saving our skins, hero.

ProdigySister_11.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_11.text: Cheers to a night we won't remember.

OwlbearCub_1.speaker: Owlbear Cub
OwlbearCub_1.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals line. A little overwhelmed by its surrounds (a party). Wrestling with its wild side.

OwlbearCub_3.speaker: Owlbear Cub
OwlbearCub_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: CautiiousNodeContext: SFX only - do not record

OwlbearCub_4.speaker: Owlbear Cub
OwlbearCub_4.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals line. Referring to tieflings with wonder.

OwlbearCub_5.speaker: Owlbear Cub
OwlbearCub_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cautious/UpsetNodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Prodigy_7.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_7.text: I expect Lia and Cal to demand yet another showcase of prestidigitation, so I'd like a moment to myself.

Prodigy_8.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_8.text: An adoring crowd, fine wine - I daresay this place is almost civilised.
Prodigy_8.context: NodeContext: Being smug but you're secretly enjoying yourself

Prodigy_1.speaker: Player
Prodigy_1.text: I saw the magic show. I wouldn't call Lia and Cal an 'adoring crowd'.

Prodigy_3.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_3.text: Only to the untrained eye. That was the fifth time they've asked for 'fireworks'. Heh. Glorified children, those two.
Prodigy_3.context: NodeContext: A rare moment of love and sincerity

Prodigy_2.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_2.text: Once my training with Lorroakan is complete, I'll put on a real show for them.

Prodigy_6.speaker: Player
Prodigy_6.text: I take it you're happy you stayed to help?

Prodigy_0.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_0.text: Not at all. But... perhaps Lia had a point. What is the point in blades and spells if we don't use them?
Prodigy_0.context: NodeContext: a rare moment of introspection and sincerity. You realised you saved these people - and it feels good.

Prodigy_9.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_9.text: Though they won't need either, soon. As Lorroakan's apprentice, I'll take care of everything.
Prodigy_9.context: NodeContext: and back to being a smug dickhead

Prodigy_4.speaker: Player
Prodigy_4.text: I'm surprised you're still here. I thought you'd be halfway to Baldur's Gate by now.

Prodigy_10.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_10.text: As did I. But Lia and Cal were so excited for tonight, I thought it cruel to leave.

Prodigy_11.speaker: Player
Prodigy_11.text: I didn't think a party beneath the stars was your idea of fun.

Prodigy_5.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_5.text: It isn't. But when one is forced among the common folk, it helps to lower expectations.
Prodigy_5.context: NodeContext: you're actually enjoying yourself but you can't NOT be a smug dickhead

FlirtyTiefling_0.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling_0.text: Consider this a preview for when we get to Baldur's Gate. Remember - the first round is on me.

FlirtyTiefling_1.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling_1.text: Go on - the others will kill me if I keep you all to myself.

FlirtyTiefling_2.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling_2.text: Go chat with the others. Wouldn't be fair to keep you all to myself - for now.

FlirtyTiefling_3.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling_3.text: Hope you're enjoying the night, hero. I certainly am. Cheers to many more like this.

CourierDog_0.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Excited barking.NodeContext: Excited barking.

CourierDog_1.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Happy panting.NodeContext: Happy panting.

CourierDog_2.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_2.text: These creatures are loud. Ugly. I hope they aren't your friends.

CourierDog_4.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_4.text: I like these people. They're joyful. It's... contagious.

CourierDog_6.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_6.text: I wish they'd stop looking at me like I'm food.

CourierDog_7.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_7.text: I wouldn't mind if you let them stay. Just a thought.

ProdigyBrother_0.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_0.text: Are Rolan and Lia actually getting along? I know you cut down a horde of goblins, but is far more impressive.
ProdigyBrother_0.context: NodeContext: Joking around but secretly pleased the night is going so well

ProdigyBrother_2.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_2.text: Elturel was the last time the three of us talked like this. Let's hope it lasts until Baldur's Gate.

BackupLeader_17.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_17.context: NodeContext: Listing things to herself - she's about to go out foraging. Sune is SOON-eh.

BackupLeader_20.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_20.text: Aye? Heading out for forage - you need something?
BackupLeader_20.context: NodeContext: Not surprised by your approach, just mentally ticking off the last of her list

BackupLeader_23.speaker: Narrator
BackupLeader_23.text: *You recognise the names - herbs known to relieve the symptoms of a hangover.*

BackupLeader_7.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_7.text: An early morning - road's stretching before us yet.
BackupLeader_7.context: NodeContext: Rueful - she's happy to see her friends enjoying herself, but she's also the guide who's going to be pushing them hard

BackupLeader_15.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_15.text: The Tel'Quessir names for those herbs are far more elegant.

BackupLeader_13.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_13.text: They're hangover cures, not high poetry.
BackupLeader_13.context: NodeContext: Unperturbed - we've corrected her on a matter of decorum, which she cares nothing for.

BackupLeader_11.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_11.text: You can teach me to pronounce that Elvish twaddle when you're half-cut later, ebrath.
BackupLeader_11.context: NodeContext: Mocking our formality, but not unkindly. 'Ebrath' is prounced EH-brath, Elvish for 'friend'. One of a few Elvish words commonly known.

BackupLeader_8.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_8.text: Foraging? There's plenty to go around here.

BackupLeader_5.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_5.text: With enough drink to make the eyes float, aye. But it's the pounding heads after I'm thinking of.
BackupLeader_5.context: NodeContext: Rueful - she's happy to see her friends enjoying herself, but she's also the guide who's going to be pushing them hard

BackupLeader_10.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_10.text: I want my people to enjoy themselves tonight - then I want them out of bed and moving by dawn.

BackupLeader_24.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_24.text: But they can chew roots while we walk. I'm not heartless.
BackupLeader_24.context: NodeContext: Rueful - making a rare joke at her own expense

BackupLeader_1.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_1.text: That's an odd diversion. Not enjoying the party?

BackupLeader_3.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_3.text: Never said I wasn't. I do enjoy it, seeing everyone like this.

BackupLeader_16.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_16.text: I won't enjoy rolling them out of bed in the morning, but I'll do it anyway.
BackupLeader_16.context: NodeContext: Sighing - she wants to let them sleep on, but knows they're not out of danger yet, celebration or no

BackupLeader_4.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_4.text: Long way yet to Baldur's Gate. Then we find a tavern, and they can carry me home.
BackupLeader_4.context: NodeContext: With conviction - she has a job to do, but plans to get blazing drunk once it's done.

BackupLeader_21.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_21.text: See if you can find some aysling mushrooms. This could be a real party.

BackupLeader_18.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_18.text: Can't say I've heard of those.
BackupLeader_18.context: NodeContext: Very natural, neutral - we're talking about hallucinogenic mushrooms, she's acting like she's unaware.

BackupLeader_9.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_9.text: Or that they bring better visions once they've been left to dry for a tenday.
BackupLeader_9.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent well - she seems an uptight character, so she relishes revealing that she knows more about these drugs than we might think.

BackupLeader_6.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_6.text: I'll have to make it up to you in Baldur's Gate. In... about a tenday, let's say.

BackupLeader_19.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_19.text: Go on, enjoy yourself. I'll hang on a while - 'til the weepy philosophy starts, anyway.
BackupLeader_19.context: NodeContext: Gently nudging us not to worry, to go party - she'll keep an eye on things for as long as she can tolerate the party. Not said with any actual venom - she likes these people.

TieflingBackup001_0.speaker: Chell
TieflingBackup001_0.text: I can't wait to get moving.
TieflingBackup001_0.context: NodeContext: Cheerfuly drunk and enjoying the evening

TieflingBackup001_2.speaker: Chell
TieflingBackup001_2.text: You won't have to worry about us anymore. I'll fight anything we meet on the road. Anything!
TieflingBackup001_2.context: NodeContext: Cheerfuly drunk and enjoying the evening

TieflingBackup001_1.speaker: Chell
TieflingBackup001_1.text: Watch out Baldur's Gate. Chell's coming for you!
TieflingBackup001_1.context: NodeContext: Cheerfuly drunk and enjoying the evening

Goblin001_14.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_14.text: True Soul! A present, straight from the battlefield.
Goblin001_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin has a lute in his hands, offering it to you.NodeContext: The goblin has a lute in his hands, offering it to you.

Goblin001_12.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_12.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Goblin001_19.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_19.text: Had to cut off the stiff's fingers to get to it.
Goblin001_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin has a lute in his hands, offering it to you.NodeContext: The goblin has a lute in his hands, offering it to you.

Goblin001_0.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_0.text: *Though it is scuffed and smeared with blood, you realise the lute belonged to Alfira, the tiefling bard.*
Goblin001_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin has a lute in his hands, offering it to you.

Goblin001_13.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_13.text: A pleasure. My name's Ripper - put in a good word for me at Moonrise, yeah?
Goblin001_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin gives you a lute.NodeContext: The goblin gives you a lute.

Goblin001_8.speaker: Player
Goblin001_8.text: You fought well. This prize is yours.

Goblin001_4.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin does a quick bow with the lute still in his hands.NodeContext: The playertold the goblin to keep his lute because he fought well. The goblin does a quick bow with the lute still in his hands.

Goblin001_17.speaker: Player
Goblin001_17.text: I know you have more than some bloodied instrument. Empty out your pockets.

Goblin001_32.speaker: Player
Goblin001_32.text: I know you have more than some bloodied instrument. Empty out your pockets.

Goblin001_29.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_29.text: Of course. Didn't mean to hold out on you, True Soul.
Goblin001_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is holding the lute in one hand.NodeContext: The goblin is a bit scared - he offered you something and you asked for more, something he didn;t expect, but he;s afraid of displeasing you. The goblin is holding the lute in one hand.

Goblin001_21.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_21.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Goblin001_11.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_11.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Goblin001_24.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_24.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Goblin001_16.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_16.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Goblin001_3.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_3.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Goblin001_1.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin gives you a weapon together with the lute.

Goblin001_5.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_5.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Goblin001_28.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_28.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Goblin001_25.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_25.text: Didn't mean to hold out on you. Just didn't think you'd be interested, is all.
Goblin001_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is holding the lute in one hand and puts his other hand in his pocket and offers you a bloody heart.NodeContext: The goblin is holding the lute in one hand and puts his other hand in his pocket and offers you a bloody heart.

Goblin001_26.speaker: Player
Goblin001_26.text: Accept both the heart and the lute.

Goblin001_6.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_6.text: A pleasure. My name's Ripper - put in a good word for me at Moonrise, yeah?
Goblin001_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin gives you a lute and a heart

Goblin001_30.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_30.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Goblin001_27.speaker: Narrator
Goblin001_27.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Goblin001_15.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin001_15.text: To think the Absolute sent you to us. We are truly blessed.

UnfortunateGnome_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_2.context: NodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrows, and tries to ignore the player, barely looking at him. The player is standing to his side. The gnome is working at a 'standing desk'

UnfortunateGnome_7.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrowsNodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrows, and tries to ignore the player, barely looking at him. The player is standing to his side. The gnome is working at a 'standing desk'

UnfortunateGnome_19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_19.text: You can take that back. It's in the way.
UnfortunateGnome_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrowsNodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrows, and tries to ignore the player, barely looking at him. The player is standing to his side. The gnome is working at a 'standing desk'

UnfortunateGnome_8.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_8.text: Lean in close to inspect what he is making.

UnfortunateGnome_14.speaker: Narrator
UnfortunateGnome_14.text: *A choking sulphur stench wafts from the twigs Barcus is cautiously assembling - explosive arrows.*
UnfortunateGnome_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in and gets a closeup of the arrows.

UnfortunateGnome_4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_4.text: Do you mind? I am trying to work.
UnfortunateGnome_4.context: NodeContext: The player is standing over Barcus' work from the side, blocking the gnome's view. Barcus has to lean back. Then he shoos the player back and starts working again,

UnfortunateGnome_13.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_13.context: NodeContext: The player complimented the gnome, but he just wants to keep working. He looks pointedly at the player (who is standing to his side).

UnfortunateGnome_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans in to inspect what the gnome is doing.

UnfortunateGnome_20.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_20.text: That's the thing - you're working when you should be celebrating.

UnfortunateGnome_3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_3.text: Celebrate? I appreciate that you're proud of your victory, but it's just that. Yours.
UnfortunateGnome_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus pockets his arrow and looks at the player.NodeContext: He turns to face the player fully (the player is standing beside him) He's a little piqued. The player told him to celebrate, but he things the victory has nothing to with him, and he wants to get to rescuing his friend.

UnfortunateGnome_29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_29.text: Wulbren is still missing, and there are gnomes trapped in Moonrise Towers.
UnfortunateGnome_29.context: NodeContext: He's a little piqued. The player told him to celebrate, but he things the victory has nothing to with him, and he wants to get to rescuing his friend.

UnfortunateGnome_40.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_40.text: Me drinking beer won't save them.
UnfortunateGnome_40.context: NodeContext: He's a little piqued. The player told him to celebrate, but he things the victory has nothing to with him, and he wants to get to rescuing his friend.

UnfortunateGnome_32.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_32.text: No, but a break might help your concentration.

UnfortunateGnome_42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_42.text: You leaving would help my concentration.
UnfortunateGnome_42.context: NodeContext: He sighs wearily before the sentence.

UnfortunateGnome_33.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus takes a contraption that looks like a bomb out of his pocket and fiddles with it.NodeContext: a bit milder - he's realising his irritation is unfounded, though he's still tired.

UnfortunateGnome_41.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_41.context: CinematicNodeContext:  He tosses the small contraption (looks like a bomb) in the air. Fireworks explode above our heads.

UnfortunateGnome_38.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_38.text: Do you? ...You can't solve the world's problems. I don't expect you to.
UnfortunateGnome_38.context: NodeContext: He sighs wearily before the second sentence. The second sentence is a bit milder - he's realising his irritation is unfounded, though he's still tired. (He's not lecturing the player, more lecturing himself for expecting the player to solve his problems, which he now admits is unrealistic)

UnfortunateGnome_28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_28.text: But... here. Take one of my old stock. I'm sure you'll find a good use for it.
UnfortunateGnome_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: He hands over an arrowNodeContext: a bit milder - he's realising his irritation is unfounded, though he's still tired. (not sarcastic). He hands over an arrow

UnfortunateGnome_27.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_27.text: Fair enough. So what are you making?

UnfortunateGnome_11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_11.text: Explosive arrows. Here, take one of my old stock and begone.
UnfortunateGnome_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: He hands over an arrowNodeContext: He wants the conversation to be done as soon as possible.

UnfortunateGnome_5.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_5.text: Your friends are as good as dead. You might as well relax.

UnfortunateGnome_16.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_16.text: Hmph. I thought you'd understand. Guess not.

UnfortunateGnome_17.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_17.text: Suit yourself, but you should join us when you're done.

UnfortunateGnome_22.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_22.text: I appreciate that you're proud of your victory, but it's just that. Yours.
UnfortunateGnome_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus pockets his arrow and looks at the player.NodeContext: He turns to face the player fully (the player is standing beside him) He's a little piqued. The player told him to celebrate, but he things the victory has nothing to with him, and he wants to get to rescuing his friend.

UnfortunateGnome_15.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_15.text: After all you did, I pegged you as a person of good standing. Guess I was wrong.
UnfortunateGnome_15.context: NodeContext: The player sided with goblins and killed an enclave of druids and tieflings. The gnome is extremely disappointed.

UnfortunateGnome_24.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_24.text: Good luck with your new friends. They'll stab you in your sleep, but at least you'll be remembered as a real bastard.
UnfortunateGnome_24.context: NodeContext: The player sided with goblins and killed an enclave of druids and tieflings. The gnome is extremely disappointed.

UnfortunateGnome_23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_23.context: NodeContext: The gnome is working on making explosive arrows, and tries to ignore the player, barely looking at him. The player is standing to his side. The gnome is working at a 'standing desk'

Goblin002_0.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin002_0.text: Heh, heh. Red with the blood of those heathens!

Goblin002_1.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Goblin002_1.text: I got it all red for ya. Red for our love for the Absolute! Heh heh heh.

Drow_7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_7.text: Already regretting your decision? I hope you're ready to beg for my company.
Drow_7.context: NodeContext: To a player who refused her sexual advances - with a sneer

Drow_4.speaker: Player
Drow_4.text: I'll beg if you want me to.

Drow_13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_13.text: Celebrate as long as you please, but save your strength. There will be no rest tonight - your body is mine.
Drow_13.context: NodeContext: at a party - to her chosen sexual partner for the night

Drow_16.speaker: Narrator
Drow_16.text: *As she looks you up and down, her mind touches yours - you feel her hand at your neck, her lips closing around yours.*
Drow_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Seductive stance and checking player out. CDavis: Player responds to the sensation of her hand on your neck then her lips closing around yours.NodeContext: describing a psychic seduction through a mind-meld

Drow_34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_34.text: Are you ready to give yourself to me?
Drow_34.context: NodeContext: a commanding question to a potential lover

Drow_24.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_24.text: If you already have doubts, you would only have disappointed me. Get out of my sight.
Drow_24.context: NodeContext: arrogant - dismissing a player who turned down her sexual advances

Drow_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_23.context: NodeContext: a command to a potential lover

Drow_21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_21.text: Good. I will join you when you go to your bed. You are mine.
Drow_21.context: NodeContext: with a cold smile - seduced the player successfully

Drow_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_14.text: In Menzoberranzan, the high-born would prostrate themselves before me for a fleeting taste of my body.
Drow_14.context: NodeContext: Menzoberranzan is her home city (men-zo-BEAR-an-zon) - annoyed that her sexual advances have been rejected

Drow_25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_25.text: You are barely worthy to look at me. Get out of my sight.
Drow_25.context: NodeContext: annoyed that her sexual advances have been rejected

Drow_1.speaker: Narrator
Drow_1.text: *Then her teeth fasten to your lip, biting, tearing - blood spills into your mouth, rushes down your throat.*
Drow_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: CDavis: Player reacting to the mental sensation of her biting your lip spilling blood.NodeContext: describing a psychic seduction turning ugly when the initiator realises her potential partner has chosen another lover

Drow_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_36.text: You have already chosen a distraction for the night, I see.
Drow_36.context: NodeContext: dismissive - arrogant. the 'distraction' is a sexual partner for the night

Drow_11.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_11.text: How disappointing for you. I could have shown you ecstasy.
Drow_11.context: NodeContext: arrogant, dismissing a player who turned down her sexual advances

Drow_12.speaker: Player
Drow_12.text: Tell me how to reach Moonrise.

Drow_9.speaker: Player
Drow_9.text: You promised safe passage to Moonrise Towers. Or did you forget?

Drow_15.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_15.text: Wait until morning, True Soul. All will be revealed.

Drow_31.speaker: Player
Drow_31.text: I met True Soul Nere in the Underdark. He warned me against working with you.

Drow_26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_26.text: Did he, now? Let me guess: the snivelling brat's failed his duty. Nothing if not expected.

Drow_18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_18.text: The goblins are your responsibility tonight. I have other matters to attend to.
Drow_18.context: NodeContext: at a party, to an ally - possibly a smirk on the last phrase; the 'other matters' she refers to is sex with one of the player's companions

Drow_29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_29.text: Begone, insect. I have found somebody more deserving.
Drow_29.context: NodeContext: arrogant and annoyed - to a potential sexual partner who refused her

Drow_33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_33.text: Celebrate our victory. We have earned the Absolute's favour, but She will ask more of us soon.
Drow_33.context: NodeContext: to an ally, at a party after a great victory

Volo_3.speaker: Volo
Volo_3.text: Quite a display that was - usually I'm the one providing the drama on nights such as these.
Volo_3.context: NodeContext: Laden with schadenfreude - we just had a public dalliance with a woman he considers psychotic, and she very nearly killed us afterwards.

Volo_42.speaker: Volo
Volo_42.text: I do hope you didn't catch anything. I'm sure an itching conscience is quite enough.
Volo_42.context: NodeContext: Very clearly false concern - he considers us scum for allying with this woman in the first place, and thinks we deserve whatever we get

Volo_91.speaker: Volo
Volo_91.text: What a fun friend you've made.
Volo_91.context: NodeContext: Falsely congratulatory. - he considers us scum for allying with this woman in the first place, and thinks we deserve whatever we get

Volo_41.speaker: Volo
Volo_41.text: You should get some rest. You've had such a big day.
Volo_41.context: NodeContext: Falsely congratulatory - we've committed an atrocity in his eyes and have forced him to be at the celebration.

Volo_55.speaker: Volo
Volo_55.text: See your guests aren't bored. The last thing we want is for them to make their own fun.

Volo_57.speaker: Volo
Volo_57.text: Ah, the guest of honour arrives! I've been observing the festivities from a sensible distance.

Volo_49.speaker: Volo
Volo_49.text: Volothamp Geddarm - realm-renowned author, auteur and now, it appears, very much your captive.

Volo_60.speaker: Volo
Volo_60.text: I'd heard tell of a goblin camp that had been overtaken by some new upstart god.

Volo_75.speaker: Volo
Volo_75.text: When I came to investigate, they invited me to stay. Rather permanently.

Volo_18.speaker: Volo
Volo_18.text: It seems that following one story has tipped me head-long into another - yours. And I truly can't wait to write it.

Volo_84.speaker: Player
Volo_84.text: Don't you want to join in the celebrations?

Volo_10.speaker: Volo
Volo_10.text: My friend, I am engaged in celebration in its purest form - commemoration.

Volo_0.speaker: Volo
Volo_0.text: I'm writing an account of your glorious victory.

Volo_78.speaker: Volo
Volo_78.text: What you did at the grove... I rather think the world should remember, don't you?
Volo_78.context: NodeContext: Volo thinks the player is a real villain. This should have the weight of 'don't you want your atrocities recorded?'

Volo_106.speaker: Volo
Volo_106.text: Your modesty does you credit, my fine friend. But bards and biographers need sordid details.

Volo_92.speaker: Volo
Volo_92.text: The grove, for example. Its destruction was quite necessary to your purpose, I have no doubt.

Volo_51.speaker: Volo
Volo_51.text: It's simply that, for the life of me, I cannot imagine what that purpose was. Could you elaborate?
Volo_51.context: NodeContext: Innocently asking the player why they have committed a mass killing of innocent civlians - as if idly curious

Volo_104.speaker: Player
Volo_104.text: The world will know my name. I don't need you for that.

Volo_96.speaker: Volo
Volo_96.text: I have no doubt! But such grand deeds as yours often require... interpretation. The grove, for example.

Volo_71.speaker: Volo
Volo_71.text: The unenlightened might see your actions there as no more than aimless slaughter.
Volo_71.context: NodeContext: Volo is laying it on thick. He hates you but wants the scoop so he's playing devil's advocate

Volo_32.speaker: Volo
Volo_32.text: I know you had a purpose. Though I'll grant that I'm quite in the dark as to what it was. Might you elaborate?
Volo_32.context: NodeContext: Innocently asking the player why they have committed a mass killing of innocent civlians - as if idly curious

Volo_80.speaker: Player
Volo_80.text: I don't need to justify myself to you.

Volo_88.speaker: Volo
Volo_88.text: Of course not! I am only here to bear witness.

Volo_70.speaker: Volo
Volo_70.text: It is for Kelemvor to judge you, when the time comes. May he do so justly.
Volo_70.context: NodeContext: Kelemvor is the god of the afterlife - being judged justly is not something the player would enjoy, in Volo's opinion

Volo_6.speaker: Player
Volo_6.text: I need the goblins to believe I'm on their side.

Volo_33.speaker: Volo
Volo_33.text: Ah, a ruse! You've played the part admirably, if I may say so.
Volo_33.context: NodeContext: Voice lowered; he's in on the secret.

Volo_47.speaker: Volo
Volo_47.text: These beasts appear quite convinced that you're a comrade in arms. Just as the tieflings were, I expect.
Volo_47.context: NodeContext: this is thick with meaning. He's subtley admonishing you for doublecrossing the tieflings.

Volo_73.speaker: Volo
Volo_73.text: But rest assured that your story is in safe hands. Volothamp Geddarm knows exactly what you are.
Volo_73.context: NodeContext: A hint of distaste to his usual enthusiasm, but not enough to cause overt offense.

Volo_69.speaker: Player
Volo_69.text: I didn't mean for any of this to happen.

Volo_28.speaker: Volo
Volo_28.text: Of course you didn't. History is but a series of accidents, after all, both happy and heinous.

Volo_56.speaker: Volo
Volo_56.text: But I daresay you're committed now, my friend. So chin up, look around, and remember your role, hm?
Volo_56.context: NodeContext: With an edge. Volo is encouraging you but he also thinks you're a war criminal.

Volo_46.speaker: Volo
Volo_46.text: That way, perhaps we'll both survive the night.

Volo_98.speaker: Player
Volo_98.text: Give me your notes. I'll decide what you write.

Volo_81.speaker: Volo
Volo_81.text: I appreciate your editorial instincts, but Deneir himself does not get a peek at my early drafts.

Volo_64.speaker: Player
Volo_64.text: And the goblins? Should I tell them what you're writing?

Volo_14.speaker: Volo
Volo_14.text: Ah, well - no need to involve your guests, I should think.

Volo_5.speaker: Volo
Volo_5.text: Here - you can keep that copy. The details are very much burned into my memory.
Volo_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Handing us his notes from his inventory (off-screen)

Volo_29.speaker: Player
Volo_29.text: Maybe I'll keep you in this cage for good.

Volo_16.speaker: Volo
Volo_16.text: ...Perhaps I spoke in haste. Your insights would, of course, be most welcome.

Volo_94.speaker: Volo
Volo_94.text: Should my writing favour facts over form, it is only to keep pace with events.

Volo_95.speaker: Volo
Volo_95.text: You have been quite busy, after all.

Volo_59.speaker: Player
Volo_59.text: You make that sound like a threat.

Volo_20.speaker: Volo
Volo_20.text: I am simply saying that you are a creature of ambition. Drive. Intent.

Volo_90.speaker: Volo
Volo_90.text: Fear not! I am content - and quite forgotten - where I am. Better in a cell than in a stew, what?

Volo_36.speaker: Volo
Volo_36.text: But I'd rather talk about you. If I'm to write an account of the battle, I'll need details while they're still sticky.

Volo_103.speaker: Volo
Volo_103.text: NO! I mean to say - I am quite content behind bars. A precautionary measure, you understand.

Volo_26.speaker: Volo
Volo_26.text: I can't rightly document your deeds from the bottom of a goblin cookpot, after all. Ha ha.

Volo_68.speaker: Volo
Volo_68.text: Aha, there you are! Come now, settle in.

Volo_72.speaker: Volo
Volo_72.text: I do hope you have partaken of something bracing? This may well take us all night.

Volo_102.speaker: Volo
Volo_102.text: That ballad was but a crude preview, a frame without its crowning jewel - your nom de guerre.

Volo_107.speaker: Volo
Volo_107.text: But I am engaged in celebration of the purest form - commemoration.

Volo_67.speaker: Volo
Volo_67.text: If we are to write your legend in the stars, then we must first give you a name.

Volo_50.speaker: Player
Volo_50.text: I have other things to do.

Volo_53.speaker: Volo
Volo_53.text: The very heart of my dilemma! You are the do-er of deeds, I the mere chronicler.

Volo_31.speaker: Volo
Volo_31.text: But how am I to ensure your most-deserved renown without a suitably thrilling title?

Volo_44.speaker: Volo
Volo_44.text: Something iconic, but not too much of a mouthful. We don't want to exclude the common-folk, after all. I intend this tale to enrapture all.

Volo_27.speaker: Volo
Volo_27.text: A wonderful one indeed - but your deeds loom larger than life now, my friend. You simply must have a title to match.

Volo_54.speaker: Player
Volo_54.text: I get it. Something flashy and made up, like 'Volothamp Geddarm'.

Volo_100.speaker: Volo
Volo_100.text: Exac-tly wrong, my friend! I urge you to leave the fact-finding to experts, hmm?
Volo_100.context: NodeContext: He was about ot say 'Exactly!' and confirm the player's claim, but hten remembered he should NOT reveal that to the player and tries to backpedal.

Volo_83.speaker: Volo
Volo_83.text: Now, back to your revels. I have some details of your victory to rearrange.

Volo_61.speaker: Volo
Volo_61.text: 'Grovekeeper'? Are you a gardener? We aim to cultivate mystery, not... shrubbery.

Volo_7.speaker: Volo
Volo_7.text: No, your actions in the grove were most heroic, but I am afraid this a matter of style, not sentiment.

Volo_76.speaker: Volo
Volo_76.text: Back to the revelry with you! I'll give the matter some thought in small council.

Volo_25.speaker: Player
Volo_25.text: 'Goblinsbane' has a nice ring to it.

Volo_77.speaker: Volo
Volo_77.text: Not to meddle in your side of this partnership, but slaying goblins is not exactly the stuff of legends, is it?

Volo_37.speaker: Volo
Volo_37.text: After all, I'm quite certain I once saw one expire from the strain of spelling his own name.

Volo_39.speaker: Volo
Volo_39.text: No, I'm afraid that won't do. You shall simply have to go out and slay something decidedly more dramatic.

Volo_1.speaker: Player
Volo_1.text: I didn't ask anyone to write my story.

Volo_86.speaker: Volo
Volo_86.text: And do you think Volothamp Geddarm got where he did by waiting to be asked?

Volo_38.speaker: Volo
Volo_38.text: No, no - it is for you to slay the dragons, and for me to worry about the accolades.

Volo_24.speaker: Volo
Volo_24.text: ...Actually slaying a dragon would prove quite helpful, mind.

Volo_52.speaker: Volo
Volo_52.text: Far too much - this is the very problem. If you could set aside your many triumphs, carry out one defining act...

Volo_15.speaker: Volo
Volo_15.text: Not to belittle your achievements to date, of course! But besting a dragon, a giant, a god perhaps... hmm.

Volo_8.speaker: Volo
Volo_8.text: I must deliberate. Go - enjoy your evening! I shall have work for you in the days to come.

Volo_23.speaker: Player
Volo_23.text: Don't you have anything of actual worth to work on?

Volo_12.speaker: Volo
Volo_12.text: 'Worth'? Volothamp Geddarm takes the matters of names most seriously.

Volo_65.speaker: Volo
Volo_65.text: And he has an arsenal of choice names for those who don't.

Volo_58.speaker: Volo
Volo_58.text: Back to your revelry, then - when I have crafted your legend for you, no doubt you shall hear of it.

Volo_93.speaker: Volo
Volo_93.text: Aha, there you are! Come now, settle in.

Volo_66.speaker: Volo
Volo_66.text: If you are to repay what you owe, then there is no time to waste. Start at the beginning.
Volo_66.context: NodeContext: Getting on with business, not taking time for us to catch up (we have no idea who this man is)

Volo_97.speaker: Volo
Volo_97.text: Volothamp Geddarm - realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker.

Volo_40.speaker: Player
Volo_40.text: I don't remember inviting you to my camp.

Volo_19.speaker: Volo
Volo_19.text: And yet I found it nonetheless. Such is the nature of Volothamp Geddarm, author and interrogator of mysteries.

Volo_89.speaker: Volo
Volo_89.text: My next piece was meant to be an exposé on the local goblins and their 'Absolute'.

Volo_109.speaker: Volo
Volo_109.text: They're quite dead now, as you know. Too dead to provide a single meaningful quote.
Volo_109.context: NodeContext: he's put out by this

Volo_79.speaker: Volo
Volo_79.text: You stole a story from me. Courtesy demands I get yours in return.
Volo_79.context: NodeContext: As if repeating a grave rule of his profession that should be self-evident to anyone.

Volo_105.speaker: Player
Volo_105.text: What I owe? What are you talking about?

Volo_63.speaker: Volo
Volo_63.text: Ye gods, then let us add ignorance to your list of crimes. I am Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker.

Volo_108.speaker: Volo
Volo_108.text: Away and have your fun! I have a myth to make.

Trainer_0.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_0.text: It's nice out here - your own little patch of paradise.
Trainer_0.context: NodeContext: Taking in the scenery of our campsite, thoughtful and a little tipsy

Trainer_2.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_2.text: Mind the g-word - every time you say 'goblin', you have to take a drink.

Trainer_1.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Asharak takes a drink after the lineNodeContext: He's just messed up his own drinking game and has to take a drink - does so after line.

ParentB_0.speaker: Komira
ParentB_0.text: Why didn't the goblins end me? Why did I survive and my little girl didn't? Damn it.

ParentB_1.speaker: Komira
ParentB_1.text: I hate this. I hate all of this.

ParentB_2.speaker: Komira
ParentB_2.text: If that snake kills another it's on you - I hope you know that.
ParentB_2.context: NodeContext: Sighing heavily at the thought. A note of steel in your voice.

ParentB_3.speaker: Komira
ParentB_3.text: I'm torn between thanking you and telling you to bugger off. But I will say this -  I'm grateful not to have blood on my hands.
ParentB_3.context: NodeContext: Sighing heavily. The woman who murdered your child runs free, and part of you is glad

ParentB_4.speaker: Komira
ParentB_4.text: I did what I had to do. And I won't hear a word about it from you or anyone else.

ParentB_5.speaker: Komira
ParentB_5.text: I'll say it a little more clearly - bugger off.

Lover2_1.speaker: Bex
Lover2_1.context: NodeContext: With all the serious intent of someone a little tipsy but nonetheless determined.

Lover2_2.speaker: Bex
Lover2_2.context: NodeContext: Merrily drunk, ecstatic and full of energy

Lover2_0.speaker: Bex
Lover2_0.text: Nope. No. I need to lie down.
Lover2_0.context: NodeContext: Suddenly realises she's a little less steady than she thought

Lover2_3.speaker: Bex
Lover2_3.text: Thanks for letting us do this. There wasn't time for a proper send-off for... for the dead.
Lover2_3.context: NodeContext: Grateful, quiet - she's thinking of her recently deceased lover.

Lover2_4.speaker: Bex
Lover2_4.text: I'd probably be tucking Danis in by now. He never could hold his drink.

SonOfChef_0.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_0.text: I won't be nursing their pounding heads and sick stomachs in the morning.
SonOfChef_0.context: NodeContext: Defiant. He's feeling left out.

SonOfChef_8.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_8.text: Your friend already forced a pint on me, thanks.

SonOfChef_9.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_9.text: This party is a bit more bearable, thanks to that pint.
SonOfChef_9.context: NodeContext: He sounds more good-natured here than in the rest of the dialogue

SonOfChef_15.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_15.text: Look at them all, guzzling poison like we've the right to be happy.

SonOfChef_18.speaker: Player
SonOfChef_18.text: We survived. That's always worth celebrating.

SonOfChef_11.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_11.text: Not everyone. We lost people, and it's like they don't even care.

SonOfChef_17.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_17.text: But I care. And I won't drink myself into a stupor to change that.

SonOfChef_7.speaker: Player
SonOfChef_7.text: Are you this unpleasant by nature or choice?

SonOfChef_4.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_4.text: I'm the only one showing proper, sober respect.

SonOfChef_3.speaker: Player
SonOfChef_3.text: You're right. This should be a sombre occasion.

SonOfChef_13.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_13.text: At least someone agrees with me.

SonOfChef_1.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_1.text: Our dead deserve a sober tribute. Not this... display.

SonOfChef_2.speaker: Player
SonOfChef_2.text: You should join them - have a pint or two.

SonOfChef_10.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_10.text: Hm. Perhaps it'll make the evening more tolerable.
SonOfChef_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a mug and sips it, grimacing.NodeContext: Angry/sarcastic

SonOfChef_12.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_12.text: I'm perfectly fine without that poison, thanks.

TieflingBackup006_0.speaker: Kivak
TieflingBackup006_0.text: Your courage is an inspiration to us all!
TieflingBackup006_0.context: NodeContext: In awe/nervously. Not formal. He's *slightly* tipsy.

TieflingBackup006_1.speaker: Kivak
TieflingBackup006_1.text: You - you're the one who saved us. It's an honour!
TieflingBackup006_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Does a little half-bow.NodeContext: In awe/nervously. Not formal. He's *slightly* tipsy.

ParentA_0.speaker: Locke
ParentA_0.text: While I'm sorry you got dragged into things with Kagha, now is not the time.
ParentA_0.context: NodeContext: Worried about your wife - just want to focus on her

ParentA_1.speaker: Locke
ParentA_1.text: So much blood and death. If we ever meet again, I hope it's under better circumstances.
ParentA_1.context: NodeContext: Sad but trying to keep it out of your voice

ParentA_2.speaker: Locke
ParentA_2.text: I want to leave this place with my wife and start anew. I wish you the same.
ParentA_2.context: NodeContext: Sighing heavily. Worried for your wife.

ParentA_3.speaker: Locke
ParentA_3.text: Thank you for intervening with Kagha. Don't know if she deserved the mercy, but I hope something good comes of it.
ParentA_3.context: NodeContext: Genuine thanks. You're glad your wife doesn't have blood on her hands.

ParentA_4.speaker: Locke
ParentA_4.text: Go on - the hero of the party deserves to have some fun.

ParentA_5.speaker: Locke
ParentA_5.text: While I hope you're enjoying the night, we'd like to be left alone.

TieflingBackup002_9.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_9.context: NodeContext: Drunk, gesturing towards you. Very excited.

TieflingBackup002_10.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_10.context: NodeContext: Jumping in joy as you cheer - gesturing for the player to dance

TieflingBackup002_13.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_13.text: A lovely offer, but I'm afraid I have to decline.

TieflingBackup002_21.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_21.text: Not a chance. One pirouette and you'll throw up.

TieflingBackup002_43.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_43.text: I only dance the dance of death - in battle.

TieflingBackup002_1.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_1.text: No. Dancing is for the weak of mind and soul.

TieflingBackup002_30.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_30.text: Milady, I am just the person you're looking for.

TieflingBackup002_15.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_15.context: NodeContext: Jumping in joy as you cheer - gesturing for the player to dance

TieflingBackup002_7.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Swaying arms and hips - very restrained and not particularly rhythimic movements

TieflingBackup002_11.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_11.context: NodeContext: NOT impressed - turning around. Looking for your next dance partner.

TieflingBackup002_19.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_19.text: Spin in a circle - hands drifting through the air.
TieflingBackup002_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spin in a circle - hands drifting through the air. Gentle movement as you elegantly dance.

TieflingBackup002_44.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tries to spin in a circle with her arms above her head - falls on her ass - laughing her head off.NodeContext: You yell this in proper drunk fashion 'A-MAH-ZIIING'

TieflingBackup002_36.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turn away - looking for your next dance partnerNodeContext: You yell this in proper drunk fashion 'BOOO-RIING'

TieflingBackup002_16.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_16.text: Kick out in a jaunty two-step.
TieflingBackup002_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jig style movement as you dance

TieflingBackup002_33.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: You try to kick the air in a jig and fall on your ass - laughing your head offNodeContext: You yell this in proper drunk fashion 'A-MAH-ZIIING'

TieflingBackup002_28.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_28.text: Perform an ancient waltz of victory.
TieflingBackup002_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gentle flowing waltz - control movements as you move

TieflingBackup002_34.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: You try to turn into a waltz and fall on your ass - laughingNodeContext: You yell this in proper drunk fashion 'A-MAH-ZIIING'

TieflingBackup002_35.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_35.context: NodeContext: Player has thrown back their head and roared. You laugh - take a deep breath and roar back - delighted.

TieflingBackup002_0.speaker: Player
TieflingBackup002_0.text: Begin a classical Baldurian courtier's dance.

TieflingBackup002_46.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_46.context: NodeContext: Player had refused you a dance.  Dramatically yelled as you turn away.

TieflingBackup002_47.speaker: Zae
TieflingBackup002_47.context: NodeContext: This player danced with you. Dramatically yelling in joy

TieflingBackup004_1.speaker: Vatas
TieflingBackup004_1.text: Kind of you to open your camp to us. We'll have to return the favour in Baldur's Gate.

Goblin003_1.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin003_1.text: Never thought I'd follow someone like you into battle - but you're twice as mean as any hobgoblin!

Goblin003_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin003_0.text: Guess ya do have some devil's blood in there, don't ya?

Goblin003_3.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin003_3.text: The Absolute smiles on you. On all of us!

Goblin003_2.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin003_2.text: We'll show those heretics. Burn them all to the ground!

ParentsAndDruidLeader_47.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_47.text: I buried my daughter because of you. I'm going nowhere.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_47.context: NodeContext: Cold and furious - you're here for blood

ParentsAndDruidLeader_35.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_35.text: I've prayed many times over that Silvanus return me to that moment.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_19.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_19.text: I am sorry, a hundred times over, and a hundred more yet.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting downNodeContext: Begging - sincere

ParentsAndDruidLeader_45.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_45.text: Your daughter roused the nest. Did you expect the viper not to strike?
ParentsAndDruidLeader_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting downNodeContext: Cold and unrepentant

ParentsAndDruidLeader_17.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_17.text: I will bear no more accusations. Leave me.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting downNodeContext: Cold and unrepentant

ParentsAndDruidLeader_48.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of wine bottle at her feet. Looks down at her hands in confusion -blinking as she moans and collapses to the ground - paralyzed.  On her back - looking up. NodeContext: Confusion as you wince, looking down at your hands. You moan and collapse to the ground - paralyzed

ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.text: I want you to feel small. I want you to feel helpless. Just like her.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: On haunches - looking Kagha in the eye. Kagha on her back - terrified.NodeContext: Crouch down on your haunches. Talking to Kagha. Deathly stare. Rage, grief and murder in your voice.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_18.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_18.text: Her name was Arabella. Picture her. How scared she was. And know - this will hurt.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stands up. Looking down at Kagha as she draws a blade. Kagha looking terrified. Unable to speak. NodeContext: Stand up - draw a blade. Murder and ice cold fury in your voice. You hate this woman with all your being.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_22.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_22.text: If you do this you are no better than her.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_38.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_38.context: NodeContext: Anger as you yell at player

ParentsAndDruidLeader_8.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_8.text: Killing Kagha won't bring her back. Don't do it.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_40.speaker: Locke
ParentsAndDruidLeader_40.text: Mari - look at her. She's miserable. Alone. Pathetic.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to Kagha NodeContext: Pleading - sincere

ParentsAndDruidLeader_12.speaker: Locke
ParentsAndDruidLeader_12.text: Don't let her drag you down with her.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_44.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Marriko clenches her fist and then kicks Kagha - kicking her viciously where she is lying on the ground on herb ackNodeContext: Cries out in pain as your are kicked

ParentsAndDruidLeader_32.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_32.text: Let's go. Before I change my mind.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_32.context: NodeContext: Brisk and determined - anger fading as you walk away

ParentsAndDruidLeader_34.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_34.text: Death is too good for her. Let her suffer with what she's done.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_31.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_31.text: Hm. You make a good point.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: Cold murderous rage

ParentsAndDruidLeader_46.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_46.text: Remember this moment. Remember Arabella's cold, dead body. And live with the blood of an innocent child on your hands.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: To KaghaNodeContext: Cold murderous rage

ParentsAndDruidLeader_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Marricko plunges the blade into Kagha multiple times - stabbing viciously. Kagha is on the ground on her back.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_1.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Marricko plunges the blade into Kagha multiple times - stabbing viciously. Kagha is on the ground on her back.NodeContext: Cry of pain as your stabbed.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_9.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_9.context: NodeContext: Coldly - turning to the player like an afterthought

ParentsAndDruidLeader_41.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_41.text: It was never about feeling better. It was about justice.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at corpseNodeContext: Not looking at player - looking down at the ground at the corpse. Sad and fatalistic.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_28.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_28.text: Not like I was sleeping at night anyway. C'mon Locke. We're done.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_28.context: NodeContext: Not looking at player - looking down at the ground at the corpse. Sad and fatalistic.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_25.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_25.text: That was a pointless waste of life.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_36.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_36.text: Then I guess Arabella and the snake now have something in common.
ParentsAndDruidLeader_36.context: NodeContext: Not looking at player - looking down at the ground at the corpse. Sad and fatalistic.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_43.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_43.text: This will only cause more pain in the end.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_27.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_27.text: Slit her throat, or she'll summon help.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_11.speaker: Komira
ParentsAndDruidLeader_11.text: As if I'd let her draw breath.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_16.speaker: Player
ParentsAndDruidLeader_16.text: Let her die nice and slow, in agony.

ParentsAndDruidLeader_39.speaker: Kagha
ParentsAndDruidLeader_39.context: NodeContext: On back - struggling to get the words out - begging. Terrified. You're about to die.

Goblin004_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin004_0.text: Anythin' shows its face here, we'll skin it alive.

Goblin004_1.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin004_1.text: Don't lift a finger, boss! I'm keepin' guard. You go have a drink!

Lover1_0.speaker: Danis
Lover1_0.text: I planned on sitting it out tonight. Then I imagined what Bex would say, and...
Lover1_0.context: NodeContext: A little timid and bittersweet. They're finally saved after month's of stress, but his lover didn't live to see it.

Lover1_3.speaker: Danis
Lover1_3.context: NodeContext: wry - he's only here and drinking because his late wife would want him to be.

Lover1_5.speaker: Danis
Lover1_5.context: NodeContext: Catching himself, thoughtful - but still drunk

Lover1_2.speaker: Danis
Lover1_2.text: Thanks for letting us do this. I feel... maybe not good. But better.
Lover1_2.context: NodeContext: Defeated - he's had his drunken outburst and just all grief now.

Lover1_4.speaker: Danis
Lover1_4.text: Do devils even grow turnips? Can't all be souls and 'flesh of the damned'.
Lover1_4.context: NodeContext: First line is drunkly pondering, second line dismissive - back to drinking.

IrritatedTiefling_1.speaker: Guex
IrritatedTiefling_1.text: Think of it - no more caves, no more tents, no more running away.

IrritatedTiefling_0.speaker: Guex
IrritatedTiefling_0.text: We'll be in a city, with roads and markets... and homes.

IrritatedTiefling_2.speaker: Guex
IrritatedTiefling_2.text: To beds and hearths! To dirty pubs and dwarven ale!
IrritatedTiefling_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises his ale.NodeContext: Making a tipsy toast.

Goblin007_0.speaker: Goblin Devout
Goblin007_0.text: Honour to fight alongside you, boss.

Goblin007_1.speaker: Goblin Devout
Goblin007_1.text: Never seen a True Soul in action before - I'd follow you to the Hells and back.

Goblin007_2.speaker: Goblin Devout
Goblin007_2.text: Once we're rested, we should carve our way right to Baldur's Gate. Whole world needs to know what we did here.

TieflingBackup005_1.speaker: Rhy
TieflingBackup005_1.text: Damn the druids, and to the hells with goblins!

TieflingBackup005_0.speaker: Rhy
TieflingBackup005_0.text: Let's raise our glasses to the future - Baldur's Gate!

TieflingBackup005_2.speaker: Rhy
TieflingBackup005_2.text: Forget Elturel, and to the hells with goblins!

TieflingBackup005_3.speaker: Rhy
TieflingBackup005_3.text: We can worry about the road tomorrow. Tonight, we drink!

Goblin005_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin005_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Moaning the loss of his beer, then jumps to attention when he notices the player.NodeContext: Grumbling to himself at first, then notices the player.

Goblin005_2.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin005_2.text: Coast all clear. Some stinkin' bird flew by some time ago, but I got it straight through the neck.
Goblin005_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jumps to attention and tries to subtly kick his beer cup out of sight.

Goblin005_1.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin005_1.text: Any of those druids is still alive, they'll know not to mess with us.

Prodigies_6.speaker: Rolan
Prodigies_6.text: Patience. Have you no respect for showmanship?
Prodigies_6.context: NodeContext: Grinning as you flex your fingers, preparing to cast a spell

Prodigies_0.speaker: Cal
Prodigies_0.context: NodeContext: Lean over and loudly stage whisper to your brother

Prodigies_10.speaker: Rolan
Prodigies_10.context: NodeContext: Grinning, enjoying the banter with cal and lia. Dramatically circling your hands as your prepare a spell (you don't need to do this, you just enjoy being a showman)

Prodigies_12.speaker: Rolan
Prodigies_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sparks fly from his hands into the air - big open gesture as you spread arms wideNodeContext: dramatic, loud and exuberant. Silver sparks fly from your hands - big open gesture as you spread your arms wide.

Prodigies_8.speaker: Lia
Prodigies_8.text: Remember when he could barely cast that?
Prodigies_8.context: NodeContext: Speaking to your brother but looking at Rolan smiling - teasing

Prodigies_4.speaker: Cal
Prodigies_4.text: I'll have you know he can also make them blue.
Prodigies_4.context: NodeContext: You're smiling and gently taing the piss out of rolan

Prodigies_2.speaker: Rolan
Prodigies_2.text: Never have I met such troglodytes. Now, pass the wine.
Prodigies_2.context: NodeContext: smiling as you pretend to be grumpy - you're enjoying the banter

Bard_5.speaker: Alfira
Bard_5.text: Your song was coming along. Then things began spinning... worry not, I shall return to it at first light!
Bard_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding her hand out - as if to steady herself.

Bard_6.speaker: Alfira
Bard_6.text: This might be the wine talking, but I'm feeling inspired.  Thinking of writing my next song - about you.

Bard_25.speaker: Alfira
Bard_25.text: But I need an angle. Any ideas?

Bard_24.speaker: Player
Bard_24.text: Not really. I'm not much of a bard.

Bard_40.speaker: Alfira
Bard_40.text: Oh, come on. There must be something!

Bard_3.speaker: Player
Bard_3.text: How about courage? Classic song material.

Bard_37.speaker: Alfira
Bard_37.text: Fitting. You're braver than half this camp combined. That deserves to be remembered.

Bard_36.speaker: Player
Bard_36.text: Have you seen this body? It would be a crime not to sing about it.

Bard_13.speaker: Alfira
Bard_13.text: Hah. As usual, getting ahead of myself. Enjoy your night, then!

Bard_32.speaker: Player
Bard_32.text: If I hear my name in a song, your life is forfeit.

Bard_15.speaker: Alfira
Bard_15.text: Oh... sure. Of course. Have a nice night.

Bard_1.speaker: Player
Bard_1.text: Skilled as I'm sure you are, I don't need my exploits put to song.

Bard_29.speaker: Alfira
Bard_29.text: Humble heroes make the best ballads. But fair - I'll not force you. Enjoy your night!

Bard_47.speaker: Player
Bard_47.text: There's just so much. Let's start with my physical beauty and go from there.

Bard_39.speaker: Alfira
Bard_39.text: 'A smile that sets the heart aglow...' You're going to love it!

Bard_4.speaker: Player
Bard_4.text: Sing of my battle spirit, and how it mirrors that of the ferocious and beloved Queen Vlaakith.

Bard_33.speaker: Alfira
Bard_33.text: I'm not familiar with this Vlaakith, I'm afraid.

Bard_28.speaker: Alfira
Bard_28.text: But if she's as ferocious as you, she must be quite impressive. I'll do my best!

Bard_35.speaker: Player
Bard_35.text: Just mention the legend that is the Blade of Frontiers, the hardiest hero to ever travel the Sword Coast.

Bard_9.speaker: Alfira
Bard_9.text: With a name like that, the song practically writes itself!

Bard_48.speaker: Player
Bard_48.text: I'd rather hear a song about Mystra.

Bard_49.speaker: Alfira
Bard_49.text: I don't know any ballads about her. But I can write one for you!

Bard_14.speaker: Alfira
Bard_14.text: 'By the Weave, and light-filled touch...' You're going to love it!

Bard_43.speaker: Player
Bard_43.text: Make it a song for everyone who fought. Couldn't have done it alone.

Bard_45.speaker: Player
Bard_45.text: Sing about our people. We deserve it.

Bard_7.speaker: Alfira
Bard_7.text: After Elturel, I think you're right. Faerûn deserves to see us as we really are.

Bard_38.speaker: Player
Bard_38.text: Maybe a song about my mixed heritage? It's a point of pride for me.

Bard_30.speaker: Alfira
Bard_30.text: Absolutely! 'With a foot in two worlds, you're the force joining both... ' You're going to love it.

Bard_2.speaker: Player
Bard_2.text: Shut it. The last thing I want is some sappy song about me.

Bard_34.speaker: Alfira
Bard_34.text: Fine, grumpypants. Serves me right for trying to be nice.

Bard_44.speaker: Player
Bard_44.text: Sing about surface elves - and how filthy and pathetic they are.

Bard_10.speaker: Alfira
Bard_10.text: Erm, all right - it's your song. Now what rhymes with 'dirty elf'...

Bard_31.speaker: Player
Bard_31.text: Let it be only as truthful as true poetry would permit.

Bard_12.speaker: Alfira
Bard_12.text: But of course. You achieved something far beyond mere fact.

Bard_23.speaker: Player
Bard_23.text: If I want a song about me, I'll write it myself.

Bard_46.speaker: Alfira
Bard_46.text: Of course. I guess it was a silly idea. Have a nice night.

Bard_19.speaker: Player
Bard_19.text: Sing about my prowess in battle.

Bard_21.speaker: Alfira
Bard_21.text: Fitting. Seeing you fight makes us, makes me, feel like I'm capable of anything.

Bard_20.speaker: Player
Bard_20.text: How about the goblin spines I'd ripped out with my bare hands?

Bard_16.speaker: Alfira
Bard_16.text: Oh! That's very... visceral. I might tone it down a touch, but I'll keep the intent.

Bard_8.speaker: Player
Bard_8.text: I don't deserve such praise. I serve a higher power.

Bard_18.speaker: Alfira
Bard_18.text: Pfft. The gods have enough people singing about them. But fine - I'll do my best!

Bard_11.speaker: Alfira
Bard_11.text: You tried the wine? My teacher never let me have any. I must say, it is delicious.

Bard_22.speaker: Alfira
Bard_22.text: Don't worry: I'm not secretly composing something for you - simply enjoying my evening.

Bard_27.speaker: Alfira
Bard_27.text: I still have no idea what to do in Baldur's Gate. Bah. That's tomorrow's problem.

Bard_42.speaker: Alfira
Bard_42.text: This might be the wine talking, but I'm feeling inspired.  I want to get a start on your song.

TieflingLeader_1.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_1.text: Go on, do your rounds. But if they hand you something purple, don't drink it - I think they got into Ethel's potions.

TieflingLeader_2.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_2.text: You have no idea how good it feels to see these people smiling.

TieflingLeader_0.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_0.text: The singing we could probably do without, but even so. Thank you.

Goblin006_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin006_0.text: Soon as the Absolute gives the command, we'll burn everythin' to the ground. No one can stop us anymore.

Goblin006_1.speaker: Goblin Tracker
Goblin006_1.text: You smoked 'em all out like it was nothin', True Soul. Imagine what a Disciple could do.

KidLeader_3.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_3.text: Go on, enjoy yourself. But if any of them sleep past noon they're getting left behind.

KidLeader_29.speaker: Player
KidLeader_29.text: Here you go. This idol's all yours.

KidLeader_15.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_15.text: Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.

KidLeader_34.speaker: Player
KidLeader_34.text: That idol of yours went missing, sorry to say.

KidLeader_24.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_24.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
KidLeader_24.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

KidLeader_8.speaker: Player
KidLeader_8.text: I didn't touch the idol. Don't know what happened to it.

KidLeader_11.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_11.text: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.
KidLeader_11.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

KidLeader_33.speaker: Player
KidLeader_33.text: And now the deal's off. Maybe this will teach you something.

KidLeader_32.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_32.text: Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.
KidLeader_32.context: NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

KidLeader_10.speaker: Player
KidLeader_10.text: Here's some free advice: never bargain, just take what's yours.

KidLeader_18.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_18.text: Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.
KidLeader_18.context: NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

KidLeader_4.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_4.text: If any of your stuff goes missing, just let me know. You're family now.

KidLeader_17.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_17.text: Somebody stole the idol. If I find out who it was... I'll recruit 'em.
KidLeader_17.context: NodeContext: exasperated on first line, as she tells us something we gave her was stolen. Beat before final phrase and delivered with a smile - it's a fun line but she's serious about recruiting good thieves

KidLeader_19.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_19.text: Hey, you. Can you keep a secret?

KidLeader_25.speaker: Player
KidLeader_25.text: Of course. My lips are easily sealed.

KidLeader_31.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_31.text: Just between you and me - I nicked some wine.

KidLeader_20.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_20.text: When the barrel's tapped out, I'll be there to save the night. For a price, of course.

KidLeader_12.speaker: Player
KidLeader_12.text: Never been a specialty of mine, no.

KidLeader_38.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_38.text: This party's boring. Should've put me in charge - now, that'd be a real party.

KidLeader_42.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_42.text: You came through for us. That's a change from most adults I know.

KidLeader_40.speaker: Player
KidLeader_40.text: Don't be so harsh on your elders.

KidLeader_22.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_22.text: I'm not. I'm glad they can celebrate before we've even got to the Gate.

KidLeader_5.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_5.text: Just like I'll be glad to be rid of them once we're there.

KidLeader_41.speaker: Player
KidLeader_41.text: Indeed - and now you owe me.

KidLeader_9.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_9.text: But if you mind your manners, maybe I'll remember you when I'm running the Gate.

KidLeader_45.speaker: Player
KidLeader_45.text: That sounded dangerously close to a compliment.

KidLeader_36.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_36.text: And that sounds like the wine drowning your wits.

KidLeader_7.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_7.text: Go on, enjoy yourself. I've squirreled away a few extra bottles.

KidLeader_14.speaker: Player
KidLeader_14.text: What are you doing way over here?

KidLeader_27.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_27.text: Watching a bunch of old folks get dumber by the dram-full. And when they run dry...

KidLeader_43.speaker: Mol
KidLeader_43.text: I've got a few bottles tucked away to keep things flowing. For a price, of course.

Goblin009_18.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Goblin009_18.text: Let the Absolute hear your prayers. Let the blood of Her enemies flow over you!

Goblin009_10.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_10.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Goblin009_30.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_30.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Goblin009_4.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_4.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Goblin009_3.speaker: Player
Goblin009_3.text: Step up to the shrine, touching your fingers to your heart and your head.

Goblin009_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Step up to the shrine, touching your fingers to your heart and your head.

Goblin009_21.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Goblin009_21.text: May the Absolute give us all power!

Goblin009_1.speaker: Player
Goblin009_1.text: My connection to the Absolute is private. I can't pray in front of lowly novices.

Goblin009_16.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Goblin009_16.text: Certainly. I meant no offence, True Soul.

Goblin009_22.speaker: Player
Goblin009_22.text: The Absolute wants more - you should add your own blood to the offering.

Goblin009_15.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Goblin009_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns to the shrine.NodeContext: You just ordered the goblin to spill his own blood in the honour of his god.

Goblin009_23.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_23.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Goblin009_2.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_2.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Goblin009_5.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Goblin009_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin holds his arm over the shrine, and then cuts open his wrist. (You don't have to show this, just suggest it and have some SFX)NodeContext: Said while the goblin slits open his own wrist.

Goblin009_24.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_24.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Goblin009_7.speaker: Narrator
Goblin009_7.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
